snippet: At 42, and 100 pounds heavier than when he began pitching in the major leagues 213 wins ago, Bartolo Colon continues to confound.
abstract: New York Mets pitcher Bartolo Colon, believed to be 42 and weighing 285 pounds, is second-oldest active player in majors and oldest starting pitcher, with 213 career wins; long, successful career of the Cy Young award winner defies public perception that a professional athlete must be lean, chiseled and mean.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Amelia Deschamps in El Copey, Dominican Republic, and Tim Rohan, Elena Gustines and Rob Harms in New York.

lead_paragraph: At 42, and 100 pounds heavier than when he began pitching in the major leagues 213 wins ago, Bartolo Colon continues to confound.

headline.print_headline: A Mets Pitcher, Noted for His Curves, Still Confounds at 42 (ish)
